snippet: A German decision to contest the pledge by Mario Draghi, president of the European Central Bank, to buy bonds if necessary has raised more questions than it has answered.
abstract: News analysis; German court decision to contest pledge by Mario Draghi, president of the European Central Bank, to buy bonds if necessary to preserve euro currency union has raised more questions than it has answered; decision suggests that European court system suffers from same kind of turf battles that have hampered politics in euro zone and prolonged crisis.
lead_paragraph: A German decision to contest the pledge by Mario Draghi, president of the European Central Bank, to buy bonds if necessary has raised more questions than it has answered.

headline.main: Court Challenge on Bond Buying Poses Test for Central Bank, and for E.U.
headline.print_headline: Court Challenge on Bond Buying Poses Test for Central Bank, and for E.U.
